article.headline: Washington St. 63, Mississippi St. 52
article.story: NEWARK, N.J. -- Klay Thompson scored 19 points and had 10 rebounds as Washington State cruised to a 63-52 victory over Mississippi State in the opening game of the Legends Classic on Friday night. Aron Baynes added 17 for the Cougars (5-0), who advanced to Saturday's championship game. They will play No. 4 Pittsburgh, who scored an easy 80-67 victory over Texas Tech in the other semifinal played Friday night. Washington State took command early on and went ahead for good on Nikola Koprivica's 3-pointer with 7:16 left in the first half. They led 35-26 at the break, and then held double-digit leads for most of the second half. Kodi Augustus, Barry Stewart and Romero Osby each scored 10 points for the Bulldogs (5-1), who made just 32 percent of their shots and committed 20 turnovers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
